references.paper_title: Optimal learning from verified training data
references.reason: This paper introduces the foundational concept of optimal learning from verified training data, which is the basis for the Stackelberg Prediction Game (SPG) addressed in the main paper.

references.paper_title: Fast algorithms for Stackelberg prediction game with least squares loss
references.reason: This paper presents fast algorithms for solving a specific case of SPG with least squares loss, which the main paper builds upon and improves.

references.paper_title: Solving Stackelberg prediction game with least squares loss via spherically constrained least squares reformulation
references.reason: This paper proposes the SCLS method, which is the primary focus and subject of the error analysis in the main paper.

references.paper_title: Stackelberg games for adversarial prediction problems
references.reason: This paper introduces the concept of Stackelberg games in the context of adversarial prediction problems, providing the theoretical foundation for the SPG model.

references.paper_title: The Gaussian min-max theorem in the presence of convexity
references.reason: This paper introduces the Convex Gaussian Min-max Theorem (CGMT), a crucial tool used in the main paper for simplifying and analyzing the error of the SCLS method.
